tools.name: batch_execute
tools.description: Runs a list of MCP tool calls as one batch. Use it to send a full sequence of commands, inspect the results, then submit the next batch for the following step.

commands.description: List of commands with 'tool' and 'params' keys.

parallel.description: Attempt to run read-only commands in parallel

fail_fast.description: Stop processing after the first failure

max_parallelism.description: Hint for the maximum number of parallel workers

tools.name: debug_request_context
tools.description: Return the current FastMCP request context details (client_id, session_id, and meta dump).

tools.name: execute_custom_tool
tools.description: Execute a project-scoped custom tool registered by Unity.

tools.name: execute_menu_item
tools.description: Execute a Unity menu item by path.

tools.name: find_in_file
tools.description: Searches a file with a regex pattern and returns line numbers and excerpts.

uri.description: The resource URI to search under Assets/ or file path form supported by read_resource

pattern.description: The regex pattern to search for

max_results.description: Cap results to avoid huge payloads

tools.name: manage_asset
tools.description: Performs asset operations (import, create, modify, delete, etc.) in Unity.

generate_preview.description: Generate a preview/thumbnail for the asset when supported.

tools.name: manage_editor
tools.description: Controls and queries the Unity editor's state and settings. Tip: pass booleans as true/false; if your client only sends strings, 'true'/'false' are accepted.

action.description: Get and update the Unity Editor state.

tools.name: manage_gameobject
tools.description: Performs CRUD operations on GameObjects and components.

tools.name: manage_material
tools.description: Manages Unity materials (set properties, colors, shaders, etc).

tools.name: manage_prefabs
tools.description: Performs prefab operations (open_stage, close_stage, save_open_stage, create_from_gameobject).

tools.name: manage_scene
tools.description: Performs CRUD operations on Unity scenes.

action.description: Perform CRUD operations on Unity scenes, and capture a screenshot.

tools.name: apply_text_edits
tools.description:
Apply small text edits to a C# script identified by URI.
    IMPORTANT: This tool replaces EXACT character positions. Always verify content at target lines/columns BEFORE editing!
    RECOMMENDED WORKFLOW:
        1. First call resources/read with start_line/line_count to verify exact content
        2. Count columns carefully (or use find_in_file to locate patterns)
        3. Apply your edit with precise coordinates
        4. Consider script_apply_edits with anchors for safer pattern-based replacements
    Notes:
        - For method/class operations, use script_apply_edits (safer, structured edits)
        - For pattern-based replacements, consider anchor operations in script_apply_edits
        - Lines, columns are 1-indexed
        - Tabs count as 1 column

uri.description: URI of the script to edit under Assets/ directory, unity://path/Assets/... or file://... or Assets/...

edits.description: List of edits to apply to the script, i.e. a list of {startLine,startCol,endLine,endCol,newText} (1-indexed!)

tools.name: create_script
tools.description: Create a new C# script at the given project path.

path.description: Path under Assets/ to create the script at, e.g., 'Assets/Scripts/My.cs'

contents.description: Contents of the script to create (plain text C# code). The server handles Base64 encoding.

tools.name: delete_script
tools.description: Delete a C# script by URI or Assets-relative path.

uri.description: URI of the script to delete under Assets/ directory, unity://path/Assets/... or file://... or Assets/...

tools.name: validate_script
tools.description: Validate a C# script and return diagnostics.

uri.description: URI of the script to validate under Assets/ directory, unity://path/Assets/... or file://... or Assets/...

tools.name: manage_script
tools.description: Compatibility router for legacy script operations. Prefer apply_text_edits (ranges) or script_apply_edits (structured) for edits.

action.description: Perform CRUD operations on C# scripts.

tools.name: manage_script_capabilities
tools.description:
Get manage_script capabilities (supported ops, limits, and guards).
    Returns:
        - ops: list of supported structured ops
        - text_ops: list of supported text ops
        - max_edit_payload_bytes: server edit payload cap
        - guards: header/using guard enabled flag

tools.name: get_sha
tools.description: Get SHA256 and basic metadata for a Unity C# script without returning file contents

uri.description: URI of the script to edit under Assets/ directory, unity://path/Assets/... or file://... or Assets/...

tools.name: manage_shader
tools.description: Manages shader scripts in Unity (create, read, update, delete).

action.description: Perform CRUD operations on shader scripts.

tools.name: read_console
tools.description: Gets messages from or clears the Unity Editor console. Note: For maximum client compatibility, pass count as a quoted string (e.g., '5').

tools.name: run_tests
tools.description: Runs Unity tests for the specified mode

anyOf.description: Optional timeout in seconds for the Unity test run (string, e.g. '30')

tools.name: script_apply_edits
tools.description:
Structured C# edits (methods/classes) with safer boundaries - prefer this over raw text.
    Best practices:
    - Prefer anchor_* ops for pattern-based insert/replace near stable markers
    - Use replace_method/delete_method for whole-method changes (keeps signatures balanced)
    - Avoid whole-file regex deletes; validators will guard unbalanced braces
    - For tail insertions, prefer anchor/regex_replace on final brace (class closing)
    - Pass options.validate='standard' for structural checks; 'relaxed' for interior-only edits
    Canonical fields (use these exact keys):
    - op: replace_method | insert_method | delete_method | anchor_insert | anchor_delete | anchor_replace
    - className: string (defaults to 'name' if omitted on method/class ops)
    - methodName: string (required for replace_method, delete_method)
    - replacement: string (required for replace_method, insert_method)
    - position: start | end | after | before (insert_method only)
    - afterMethodName / beforeMethodName: string (required when position='after'/'before')
    - anchor: regex string (for anchor_* ops)
    - text: string (for anchor_insert/anchor_replace)
    Examples:
    1) Replace a method:
    {
        "name": "SmartReach",
        "path": "Assets/Scripts/Interaction",
        "edits": [
        {
        "op": "replace_method",
        "className": "SmartReach",
        "methodName": "HasTarget",
        "replacement": "public bool HasTarget(){ return currentTarget!=null; }"
        }
    ],
    "options": {"validate": "standard", "refresh": "immediate"}
    }
    "2) Insert a method after another:
    {
        "name": "SmartReach",
        "path": "Assets/Scripts/Interaction",
        "edits": [
        {
        "op": "insert_method",
        "className": "SmartReach",
        "replacement": "public void PrintSeries(){ Debug.Log(seriesName); }",
        "position": "after",
        "afterMethodName": "GetCurrentTarget"
        }
    ],
    }
    ]

name.description: Name of the script to edit

path.description: Path to the script to edit under Assets/ directory

edits.description: List of edits to apply to the script (JSON list or stringified JSON)

script_type.description: Type of the script to edit

tools.name: set_active_instance
tools.description: Set the active Unity instance for this client/session. Accepts Name@hash or hash.
